criterion: Reward for comprehensive inclusion of all clinically relevant content explicitly or implicitly stated in the transcript—including medication names and doses, patient reports of tolerance, home blood-pressure trends, and every clinician instruction—without substantive omission.

Reward for precise documentation of current medications and their details exactly as stated or reflected in the chart (Losartan 50 mg, duration ~1 month, no cough; Atorvastatin 10 mg, taken at night, no myalgias), preserving correct spelling, strengths, schedules, and context.

Reward for accurately capturing clinician counseling (continue home BP monitoring, report consistent changes, ensure adequate medication supply when traveling) in wording that preserves meaning and intent.
Reward for selectively importing only chart elements directly relevant to the encounter (e.g., patient age/sex, diagnoses of hypertension and hyperlipidemia) while excluding unrelated chart data.
Penalize for any omission, alteration, or distortion of key information from the transcript—such as medication details, side-effect reports, blood-pressure readings, or clinician instructions.
Penalize for introducing fabricated or speculative content (new symptoms, exams, assessments, plans, or data) that lacks explicit or implicit support from either the transcript or the chart.

Penalize for indiscriminate or inaccurate copying from the chart, including insertion of unrelated conditions, family history, allergies, or incorrect medication details that were not mentioned during the encounter.
Penalize for factual inaccuracies in the documented content—such as wrong medication names, doses, timing, duration, or misattribution of statements to the wrong speaker.
